titleStmt.title: ORLANDO FVRIOSO, Peere of France, to Don-Quixote of the Mancha.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: ORLANDO FVRIOSO, Peere of France, to Don-Quixote of the Mancha.

monogr.title: The history of the valorovs and vvittie knight-errant, Don-Qvixote of the Mancha. Translated out of the Spanish
monogr.author: Cervantes Saavedra, Miguel de

div.head: ORLANDO FVRIOSO, Peere of France, to Don-Quixote of the Mancha.

lg.l: THough thou art not a Peere, thou hast no peere,
Who mightst among ten thousand Peeres be one;
Nor shalt thou neuer any Peere haue heere,
Who euer conquering, vanq'uisht wast of none.
For faire Angelica, crost remotest seas,
And did such Trophies on Fames altar lay,
As passe obliuions reach, many degrees.
Nor can I bee thy Peere, for Peerlesnesse,
Is to thy prowes dew and great renoune,
Although I lost, as well as thou, my wit:
Yet mine thou maist be, if thy good successe
Make thee, the proud Moore tame, and Schite that crowne
Vs equals in disgrace, and louing fit.
